text: Presidential elections were held in Colombia on 2 February 1892. The result was a victory for Rafael Núñez of the National Party.Colombia: Elecciones Presidenciales de 1826 a 1990 Political Database of the Americas ==Electoral system== The 1886 constitution changed the presidential electoral system from one where a candidate had to win a majority of states to be elected (or be elected by Congress if no candidate won a majority of states), to a two-stage system. Voters meeting literacy and property requirements (which were not required for local and regional elections) elected members of an electoral college, who in turn elected the President.Elections and Events 1850-1899 The Library, UC San Diego ==Results== ===President=== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Candidate !Party !Votes !% |- |align=left|Rafael Núñez||align=left|National Party||2,075||80.30 |- |align=left|Marceliano Vélez||align=left|Conservative Party||509||19.70 |- |align=left colspan=2|Total||2,584||100 |- |align=left colspan=4|Source: PDBA |} ===Vice President=== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Candidate !Party !Votes !% |- |align=left|Miguel Antonio Caro||align=left|National Party||2,082||80.54 |- |align=left|José Joaquín Ortiz||align=left|Conservative Party||503||19.46 |- |align=left colspan=2|Total||2,585||100 |- |align=left colspan=4|Source: The Library |} ==References== Category:1892 elections in South America 1892 Category:1892 in Colombia
title: 1892 Colombian presidential election
